content: It's not clear to me when creating an External Mention on B.org if the 'Link to mention: Title' should be the title of the article (which is already in the main Title field), or the name of the website where the article is...

When I create them, I usually put the same thing in those fields :shrug: ...if we had https://github.com/backdrop-contrib/auto_nodetitle installed on b.org, then we could hide the node title field and simply have the title generated using the link label.

backdrop-contrib/auto_nodetitle
A port of the Automatic Node Title Drupal 7 module to BackdropCMS - backdrop-contrib/auto_nodetitle
Yes, I've always felt that was a little weird. But, I just haven't had the energy to question it.
Would be nice to get that fixed.
Or just disable the link title field and use the node title for that instead...?
Yeah, or that :+1:
